intro.speaker: Kjelle
intro.line: Dishonorable cur! You killed my master, and now you will face me!

intro.speaker: Cassius
intro.line: If that pile of pudding was your master, I'd advise you to just keep walking.

intro.speaker: Kjelle
intro.line: Craven dog... You claimed a hostage! He'd never have lost in a fair fight!

intro.speaker: Maiden
intro.line: Nor would he have wanted this, Kjelle. If I lose you as well, I...

intro.speaker: Kjelle
intro.line: You won't lose me. I swear it. And I swear your husband will be avenged!

intro.speaker: Cassius
intro.line: If you want to run headlong into the grave, girl, I won't stop you. We can duel in the ruins ahead.

intro.speaker: Robin
intro.line: What do you make of this, Chrom?

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I hope she knows what she's getting into.

intro.speaker: Maiden
intro.line: Sir! Please! You have to do something!

intro.speaker: Maiden
intro.line: It's my friend, sir. I fear she's walking into a terrible trap! That scoundrel Cassius would never fight an honest duel. My husband took a similar stand against his tyranny not long ago. The brute took a girl hostage and then cut my husband down as he lowered his weapon! *Sniff* I can't let her suffer the same fate... I'd die, I would!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: All right. We'll see what we can do.

battle.speaker: Kjelle
battle.line: Coward! You promised me a duel, you soulless blackheart!

battle.speaker: Cassius
battle.line: Indeed I did. Consider all these men my seconds, heh. Still, I'm not a monster. I'll spare your life if you get on your knees and beg.

battle.speaker: Cassius
battle.line: Well, we can arrange that, too. Have at her, boys!

recruit-talk.speaker: Sully
recruit-talk.line: Hey. You got a second?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: Ahh!

recruit-talk.speaker: Sully
recruit-talk.line: What? I got something on my face?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: N-no, you just...remind me of someone. Forgive me. I have no time to talk.

recruit-talk.speaker: Sully
recruit-talk.line: Don't worry. It won't take long. So listen. These lowlifes have no honour. You know that, right? If you meet 'em head-on, you'll just end up with a sword in your back.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: Head-on is how I live.

recruit-talk.speaker: Sully
recruit-talk.line: ...Ooh, I like you. And that's all the more reason I can't let you charge off on your own.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: Don't try to stop me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Sully
recruit-talk.line: I'm not stopping you. I'm coming with you. You just focus on finishing your duel, and I'll kill any idiot who gets in the way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: R-right!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Excuse me—

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: Wha—?! Die, fiend! Y-you parried my spear. ...How did you do that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I get a lot of practice. Now can you please stop trying to skewer me for a second? We're not your enemies. A friend sent us to help you. There are too many for you to fight alone, no matter your skill. We'll take care of the rabble while you fight your duel.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: You would do this for a stranger?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Is that a problem?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: N-no, of course not. Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Excuse me—

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: Wha—?! Die, fiend! Y-you parried my spear. But how did you... Wait. Do I know you? I feel as if we've met, but... No, that's impossible.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: I hate to interrupt your musing, but could you perhaps lower your spear? We've been sent here to help you. They are too many for you to fight alone. We'll take care of the rabble while you fight your duel.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: You would do this for a stranger?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Is that a problem?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kjelle
recruit-talk.line: N-no, of course not. Thank you.

boss.speaker: Cassius
boss.line: Most people think a man who fights dirty is too weak to win otherwise. Heh heh... Suits me just fine. A cocky fool is an easy target!

boss.speaker: Kjelle
boss.line: If you believe in gods, you'd better pray to them now!

boss.speaker: Cassius
boss.line: Aye, I suppose not. Most fools assume that liars and sneaks like me are weak. They want us to be weak, see? They NEED it. It lets them hold on to the fantasy that right prevails in the end. Heh... They can think what they want. A cocky fool is an easy target. Truth is, in the end, it's the clever ones who always survive.

boss.speaker: Kjelle
boss.line: A man who takes hostages in order to win a duel has no claim to cleverness. Even an animal would not stoop so low! But enough. I've no more words to waste on the likes of you. My master will have vengeance!

boss.speaker: Cassius
boss.line: Wrong, girl. Your master will have COMPANY!

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: Kjelle! Thank the gods you're safe!

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: I kept my promise. Your husband can rest in peace now.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: I may have a way to thank you. This was his, and I'm sure he would have wanted you to have it.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: This is a precious keepsake. Its rightful place is with you.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: I'll not forget my husband for lack of a memento, dear. Now please, take it.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: You're certain?

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: Absolutely.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: Then...thank you.

end.speaker: Maiden
end.line: Just swear to take care of yourself, Kjelle. Swear you'll stay safe.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: I swear it.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Looks like the good guys won after all. Ain't that a kick in the teeth?

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: Thank you for your help, but I fear other tasks yet lie ahead of me. I still have to find my parents.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Aw, hell. Your parents are missing? That's rough, kid. Any idea where they might have gone?

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: I have a ring my father gave my mother, but precious little else to go on.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Mind if I take a look?

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: No, of course not.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Well, I'll be damned... Kid? This is MY ring.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: Your ring? But then...

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Hah! I get it. You're one of the kids who came back with Lucina, yeah? Which means...I've got a new lead for you on the parent front, kiddo. ...I'm your mom.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: Y-you?!

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: You expecting someone prettier?

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: N-no! Of course not! I mean... You look as beautiful now as when I knew you.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Har! So I'm not all wrinkled or missing a hand or anything? That's a relief.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: You were a beautiful and vibrant woman, despite the ill times we lived in. You taught me how to be strong. You taught me to survive.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: All right, kid, sit down. I want to know every last detail about the future.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: You bet!

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: ...Is that how you address you mother?

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: I mean, y-yes! Yes ma'am!

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: Much better.

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: Hee hee. You always were tough on me.

end.speaker: Sully
end.line: That's right. Any child of mine is gonna have to learn to respect their elders!

end.speaker: Kjelle
end.line: ...It's good to see you, Mother.
